problems.title: Arithmetic Slices (Sliding Window)
problems.description:
An integer array is called arithmetic if it consists of at least three elements and if the difference between any two consecutive elements is the same.
Given an integer array nums, return the number of arithmetic subarrays of nums.

Input Format:
First line: integer n.
Second line: n space-separated integers.

Output Format:
Print a single integer: the number of arithmetic subarrays.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
4
1 2 3 4

Sample Output
3

Explanation: We have 3 arithmetic slices in nums: [1, 2, 3], [2, 3, 4] and [1,2,3,4] itself.
hintsList: Think about how to use a sliding window to optimize the solution.
Consider using a frequency map or two pointers to track the window state.
